title: Early turnout shatters record in Canada polls with 7.3m ballots cast
snippets: Elections Canada, the organisation which runs federal elections, reports a 25% jump when compared to early voting in 2021 polls.
titles: Early turnout shatters record in Canada polls with 7.3m ballots cast
summary: Elections Canada has reported a 25% increase in early voting turnout for federal elections compared to the 2021 polls. This indicates a higher level of voter participation in the early stages of the election process.

title: Mission to boldly grow food in space labs blasts off
snippets: The mission will explore new ways of reducing the cost of feeding an astronaut.
titles: Mission to boldly grow food in space labs blasts off
constructiveness_reason: The story highlights an innovative solution for food production in space, providing empowering knowledge about technological advancements.
summary: A new mission aims to explore innovative methods to decrease the expenses associated with providing food for astronauts. This initiative seeks to identify and implement more cost-effective strategies for astronaut nutrition, potentially revolutionizing how sustenance is supplied in space missions.

title: More than 20 killed after gunmen open fire on tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir
snippets: The region's chief minister said the attack was "much larger than anything we've seen directed at civilians in recent years".
titles: More than 20 killed after gunmen open fire on tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir
summary: A significant attack targeting civilians occurred in the region, described by the chief minister as the largest in recent years. The specific details of the attack, including its nature, location, or the number of casualties, were not provided. However, the statement highlights the severity and unprecedented scale of the incident compared to previous events.

title: Video: Tourists killed in Indian-administered Kashmir attack
snippets: A group of gunmen have killed at least 28 tourists visiting Pahalgam in Indian-administered Kashmir.
titles: Video: Tourists killed in Indian-administered Kashmir attack
summary: A group of gunmen attacked tourists in Pahalgam, Indian-administered Kashmir, resulting in at least 28 deaths.

title: Israeli attacks kill 32 in Gaza, destroy bulldozers for recovering the dead
snippets: UNRWA says Gaza has become 'a land of desperation' as Israel continues to pound the strip and block humanitarian aid.
titles: Israeli attacks kill 32 in Gaza, destroy bulldozers for recovering the dead
summary: The United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) has reported that Gaza is now described as "a land of desperation" due to ongoing Israeli military actions and the blockade that restricts humanitarian aid from entering the area. This situation has escalated tensions and worsened living conditions for residents.

title: Lex Luger details miraculous recovery from near quadriplegic to standing for WWE Hall of Fame: 'I was at the breaking point'
snippets: Lex Luger's induction into the WWE Hall of Fame this past Friday was heartwarming for more than the obvious reasons.
titles: Lex Luger details miraculous recovery from near quadriplegic to standing for WWE Hall of Fame: 'I was at the breaking point'
summary: Lex Luger was inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame on Friday, in an event that was widely regarded as heartwarming. This recognition marks a significant milestone in Luger's career, celebrating his contributions and achievements in professional wrestling.

title: US Center for SafeSport fires CEO Ju'Riese Colón, the latest sign of crisis for the Olympic watchdog
snippets: Ju’Riese Colon has been fired as CEO of the U.S. Center for SafeSport in the latest and most visceral sign of a crisis that began after revelations the center had hired an investigator who would later be charged with rape.  The center said its board chair, April Holmes, would lead an interim management committee composed of board members while they search for Colon’s replacement.  “We are grateful for Ju’Riese’s leadership and service,” Holmes said in the statement sent to the AP.
titles: US Center for SafeSport fires CEO Ju'Riese Colón, the latest sign of crisis for the Olympic watchdog
summary: Ju’Riese Colon was terminated as CEO of the U.S. Center for SafeSport following a scandal involving the hiring of an investigator later charged with rape. The organization announced that April Holmes, the board chair, will head an interim management committee during the search for a new CEO. The center expressed gratitude for Colon's leadership in their statement.

title: Aiken High baseball looking to correct mental mistakes before South Aiken rematch, playoffs
snippets: Apr. 22—Monday night offered a mixed bag for the Aiken High baseball team. The Hornets got off to a disastrous start against rival South Aiken, only to rally back to produce the kind of nailbiter that has been the standard between these two programs for years. Aiken battled, earning opportunities to potentially tie or take the lead, only to be turned away over the last two innings. The 8-6 ...
titles: Aiken High baseball looking to correct mental mistakes before South Aiken rematch, playoffs
summary: On April 22, the Aiken High baseball team faced South Aiken in a closely contested game. After a poor start, Aiken High rallied to bring the game to a nail-biting conclusion but ultimately fell short, losing 8-6. Despite their comeback efforts and chances to tie or lead in the final innings, they were unable to secure a victory against their rivals.

title: South Aiken baseball team figuring out how to win as playoffs approach
snippets: Apr. 22—It hasn't been the easiest season for the South Aiken baseball team. The T-Breds have some youth and inexperience in key spots, and some of their veteran players have had to make adjustments to either take on new roles or add to the ones they were already filling — all while competing in South Carolina's region of doom. Close losses in region play — five by three runs or less — started ...
titles: South Aiken baseball team figuring out how to win as playoffs approach
summary: The South Aiken baseball team has faced challenges this season due to a mix of youth and inexperience among its players, along with veterans adjusting to new or expanded roles. Competing in South Carolina's tough region, the team has experienced close losses, with five games lost by three runs or less. Despite these obstacles, the T-Breds continue to compete and adjust in a difficult environment.

title: Guardiola hails match winner Nunes
snippets: Pep Guardiola paid tribute to Matheus Nunes after his last-gasp winner against Aston Villa saying the Portuguese ace is ‘incredibly loved’ in the City dressing room.Nunes popped up with the decide...
titles: Guardiola hails match winner Nunes
summary: Pep Guardiola praised Matheus Nunes for his crucial late goal that secured Manchester City a win against Aston Villa. Guardiola highlighted Nunes's popularity within the team, describing him as 'incredibly loved' in the City dressing room. Nunes's decisive goal was a key moment in the match, earning him special recognition from the manager.

title: Mining Stocks Still Have Room To Rise as Gold Hits Record High, Jefferies Says
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The price of gold hit a fresh record high Tuesday, briefly crossing $3,500 per ounce.
  • Jefferies analysts said Tuesday shares of companies that mine the precious metal could still have room to rise. 
  • The analysts raised their price targets for some mining stocks such as Agnico Eagle and Newmont ahead of the companies' earnings reports this week. 


As gold prices keep hitting record highs, Jefferies analysts said shares of companies that mine the precious metal could still have room to rise.

The price of gold briefly crossed $3,500 per ounce Tuesday, setting a record for the second day in a row. At $3,387 per ounce in recent trading, the precious metal has risen nearly 30% so far in 2025. Gold is “the only true safe haven left,” Jefferies analysts told clients Tuesday, amid worries about a U.S. trade war with China and President Donald Trump’s recent comments attacking Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. 

However, gold mining stocks haven’t all caught up to the rally, Jefferies said. The current prices of mining stocks would suggest a gold price of about $2,500 per ounce, the analysts said, well below the current level. The analysts pointed to Barrick Gold (GOLD) as a possible “catch-up” candidate, and raised their price targets for several other miners including Agnico Eagle (AEM) and Alamos Gold (AGI).

Bank of America Also Boosts Stock Targets for Gold Miners

Meanwhile, Bank of America Securities lifted its targets for Barrick, Agnico, and Alamos, along with Newmont (NEM), whose shares have jumped nearly 50% this year.

Newmont is due to report first-quarter earnings Wednesday, with Agnico expected a day later. Alamos and Barrick are set to follow on April 30 and May 7, respectively.
titles: Mining Stocks Still Have Room To Rise as Gold Hits Record High, Jefferies Says
summary: The price of gold reached a new record high, briefly surpassing $3,500 per ounce, amid U.S. trade tensions and comments from President Donald Trump. Analysts from Jefferies and Bank of America have raised their price targets for gold mining stocks, such as Agnico Eagle, Newmont, Alamos Gold, and Barrick Gold, suggesting these have not yet fully matched the gold price rally. Despite the recent surge, gold mining stocks are currently priced as if gold were at $2,500 per ounce, indicating potential for further gains. Newmont and Agnico are set to report their earnings soon, with Alamos and Barric

titles: US markets rally as Treasury secretary says China trade war is ‘unsustainable’
summary: Scott Bessent, an investor, has informed his investors that he anticipates a deal will be reached between two countries. This agreement is expected to conclude the existing restrictions on the flow of goods.

snippets: Electric-car maker’s sales knocked by political ‘blowback’
titles: Musk to prioritise Tesla over White House role as profits slump
summary: An electric car manufacturer has experienced a decline in sales due to political backlash. The company, which was not named, is facing challenges as a result of negative political sentiment affecting its market performance. This situation highlights the impact of political factors on the automotive industry, particularly for electric vehicle producers.

title: Amazon and Walmart sellers hoard goods in Canada to wait out tariffs
snippets: Third-party vendors are betting that White House will back down on steep China levies
titles: Amazon and Walmart sellers hoard goods in Canada to wait out tariffs
summary: Third-party vendors are anticipating that the White House will retract its decision on imposing high tariffs on China. This expectation stems from their belief in a potential policy shift or negotiation outcome that could lead to a reduction or elimination of the current steep levies.

title: Economic Uncertainty Remains Key Factor In Auto Industry Outlook, Says BofA
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Bank of America analysts said the auto industry will likely report positive results this quarter, but the future is far less certain.
  • Companies could suspend or pull their guidance due to tariffs, the analysts said.
  • If auto tariffs stay at or near current levels, BofA analysts predict that production and sales volumes will decline by nearly 3 million units.


Economic uncertainty remains a key factor in the outlook for the auto industry.

Bank of America analysts wrote Tuesday that they anticipate positive auto industry results this quarter, though uncertainty around tariffs and other factors could cause some companies to pull or suspend their guidance. 

The first quarter of the year has likely shaped up better than expected for auto companies' production and sales, the analysts wrote. Americans are “panic buying” cars so they can beat the heftier price tags that many expect in the wake of auto-specific tariffs.

However, the results may be less important as investors will likely be paying close attention to outlooks and increasing conversations around tariffs. The bank cut price targets across multiple carmakers, parts, and dealer stocks. One example is Tesla (TSLA), which reported weak deliveries earlier this month and missed Q1 earnings estimates on Tuesday.

Analysts said it will be hard for companies to provide expectations beyond the first quarter amid tariff uncertainty. The bank predicts that production and sales will decline by about 3 million vehicles if auto tariffs stay at or near current levels. This could lower operating earnings for General Motors (GM) by 11%, by 7% for Ford (F), 10 to 15% for suppliers, and 3% to 5% for dealers, they estimate.
titles: Economic Uncertainty Remains Key Factor In Auto Industry Outlook, Says BofA
summary: Bank of America analysts predict positive auto industry results for this quarter but warn that future outcomes are uncertain due to tariffs. They anticipate that if tariffs remain at current levels, the auto industry could see a production and sales decline of nearly 3 million units. This situation may lead companies to suspend or withdraw their financial guidance, affecting operating earnings significantly for major companies like General Motors, Ford, and various suppliers and dealers. The analysts also note that economic uncertainty and tariff concerns are causing shifts in investor focus a

title: Insects are disappearing due to agriculture -- and many other drivers, new research reveals
snippets: Insects are disappearing at an alarming rate worldwide, but why? Agricultural intensification tops the list of proposed reasons, but there are many other, interconnected drivers that have an impact, according to new research.
titles: Insects are disappearing due to agriculture -- and many other drivers, new research reveals
constructiveness_reason: The story increases awareness about the impact of agriculture on insect populations and provides deeper understanding based on new research.
summary: New research indicates that insects are disappearing globally at an alarming rate, with agricultural intensification identified as the primary cause. However, the study also points out several other interconnected factors contributing to this decline.

title: Oil cleanup agents do not impede natural biodegradation
snippets: Biodegradation is an important natural process during oil spill cleanup. A new study revealed that using spill treating agents does not negatively impact naturally occurring biodegradation.
titles: Oil cleanup agents do not impede natural biodegradation
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about oil cleanup methods and their impact on natural biodegradation, contributing to decision-making in environmental cleanup efforts.
summary: A new study has found that the use of spill treating agents in oil spill cleanup does not adversely affect the process of biodegradation, which is crucial for naturally addressing oil spills. This discovery supports the continued use of these agents in mitigating environmental damage from oil spills.

title: LHC breaks the record for heaviest antimatter nucleus ever seen
snippets: Researchers at the Large Hadron Collider found evidence of an unprecedentedly heavy and exotic form of antimatter in the aftermath of a collision between extremely fast lead ions
titles: LHC breaks the record for heaviest antimatter nucleus ever seen
summary: Researchers at the Large Hadron Collider have discovered evidence of a new, extremely heavy form of antimatter. This discovery was made following collisions between highly accelerated lead ions. The finding marks a significant advancement in the study of antimatter, offering insights into the complexities of particle physics.

title: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
snippets: Machine learning helped show how harnessing the weird effects of Einstein’s special relativity could enable a new kind of quantum computer – and it could also lead to new insights into the quantum realm
titles: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
summary: Machine learning has been utilized to explore the potential of utilizing the principles of Einstein's special relativity to develop a new type of quantum computer. This approach could also offer fresh insights into the quantum realm, indicating a significant advancement in the understanding and application of quantum mechanics and relativity in computing technology.

title: Phone game lowers social anxiety by shifting focus on to the positive
snippets: The game, called StarStarter, rewards players for directing their attention away from negative stimuli and towards positive ones
titles: Phone game lowers social anxiety by shifting focus on to the positive
summary: StarStarter is a game designed to encourage players to focus on positive stimuli instead of negative ones by offering rewards. This innovative approach aims to promote a more positive mindset among its players by leveraging the rewarding aspects of gameplay.
